name: Atomic Structure
description: Atoms consist of protons, neutrons, and electrons. Protons and neutrons form the nucleus, while electrons orbit in shells. Atomic number equals protons; mass number equals protons plus neutrons.

name: Periodic Table
description: Elements are organized by atomic number in periods (rows) and groups (columns). Groups share similar properties. Main groups include alkali metals, alkaline earth metals, halogens, noble gases, and transition metals.

name: Chemical Bonding
description: Atoms bond through ionic (electron transfer), covalent (electron sharing), or metallic bonding. Bond strength affects molecular properties like melting point and solubility.

name: Stoichiometry
description: The quantitative relationship between reactants and products in chemical reactions. Based on the law of conservation of mass and balanced chemical equations.

name: Acids and Bases
description: Acids donate H+ ions (pH < 7), bases accept H+ ions (pH > 7). pH scale measures acidity/basicity. Strong acids/bases completely dissociate; weak ones partially dissociate.

name: Redox Reactions
description: Oxidation-reduction reactions involve electron transfer. Oxidation is electron loss (increase in oxidation state); reduction is electron gain (decrease in oxidation state).

name: Thermochemistry
description: Study of energy changes in chemical reactions. Exothermic reactions release heat (ΔH < 0); endothermic reactions absorb heat (ΔH > 0). Enthalpy, entropy, and Gibbs free energy govern spontaneity.

name: Chemical Equilibrium
description: Dynamic state where forward and reverse reaction rates are equal. Le Chatelier's principle predicts how equilibrium shifts with changes in concentration, temperature, or pressure.

name: Organic Chemistry
description: Study of carbon-based compounds. Includes hydrocarbons, functional groups, isomers, and reactions like substitution, addition, elimination, and condensation.

name: Electrochemistry
description: Study of chemical reactions involving electron transfer. Includes galvanic cells (spontaneous), electrolytic cells (non-spontaneous), and electrode potentials.

name: Kinetics
description: Study of reaction rates and mechanisms. Factors affecting rate: concentration, temperature, catalysts, surface area. Rate laws express relationship between rate and reactant concentrations.

name: Gas Laws
description: Ideal gas law (PV = nRT) relates pressure, volume, moles, and temperature. Includes Boyle's law, Charles's law, and Avogadro's law.

name: Solutions and Solubility
description: Solutions are homogeneous mixtures. Concentration units include molarity, molality, and mole fraction. Solubility depends on polarity ('like dissolves like') and temperature.

name: Nuclear Chemistry
description: Study of nuclear reactions including radioactive decay (alpha, beta, gamma), half-life, fission, and fusion. Applications in medicine, energy, and dating.

name: Molecular Geometry
description: VSEPR theory predicts molecular shapes based on electron pair repulsion. Common geometries: linear, trigonal planar, tetrahedral, trigonal bipyramidal, octahedral.
